title: US economy bailed out by resilient shoppers but analysts warn of darkening outlook
text:
Resilient shoppers bailed out the US economy in the third quarter as hopes of more stimulus were dented by growth holding up against intensifying headwinds from the trade war and a darkening global outlook.

A sharp decline in business investment caused the economy to cool slightly in the three months to September but the slowdown was much less severe than economists had expected.

Growth slowed to 1.9pc on an annualised basis compared to the previous quarter, down from 2pc, as solid consumer spending offset a 3pc drop in business investment.

The resilient growth will assuage some fears the US economy is hurtling towards recession as trade tensions weigh heavily on business confidence. Personal...
description: Resilient shoppers bailed out the US economy in the third quarter as hopes of more stimulus were dented by growth holding up against intensifying headwinds from the trade war and a darkening global outlook.
